title: What is the difference between moralization and divinization according to Plotinus?
first_phrase: This text explores the idea of divinification and initiation from a philosophical perspective using the words of Plotinus. It emphasizes the importance of transcending morality and embracing a pure intellectual principle, beyond the duality of good and evil. The text uses examples to illustrate how certain actions can either hinder or support spiritual development, which goes beyond simple moralistic prescriptions. The author emphasizes the Hellenic view of goodness as an ontological state of reality and perfection rather than just an ethical concept. Overall, the text presents a unique perspective on spiritual development and emphasizes the importance of embracing the pure intellectual principle to achieve divinity.

last_phrase: In conclusion, it is crucial to overcome both irrational and impulsive tendencies by embracing the pure intellectual principle that goes beyond the distinction between good and evil. The ancient Hellenic world had a unique perspective on the nature of goodness, which was not exclusively moral but also ontological. As we move forward in our initiation, it is important to keep these perspectives in mind and to distinguish the two phases that are part of the process.
